373ea2ca-e47f-456a-9cd7-258d20772be1.body:
What does this code snippet do? 
total = 0
for i in 1, 3, 7:
   total = total + i
   print(total)

options.A: This code prints the value in total which is the sum of the numbers 1, 3 and 7
options.B: This code prints 11 - the sum of the numbers 1, 3 and 7
options.C: The code reassigns to the total variable, the sum of the numbers 1,3,7 and prints it

57b7f3bf755f6214006d7032.name: QUIZ 3
57b7f3bf755f6214006d7032.description: This section will test understanding of object oriented programming.

c0554ea9-f36e-4651-8a62-4873b014594f.body: Which of the following choices contains the terms that are most closely associated with Object Oriented Programming?

f0624556-2ed7-4212-ad59-d80057910272.body:
Consider the following statements.
  1. Class attributes are more suitable for sharing data across instances of a class as opposed to instance variables.
  2. Instance variables always point to a common location in memory regardless of which instance of a class is used to access them
  3. Abstraction cannot be utilized without Inheritance
  4. In order to enable access to instance variables, functions must have a “self” argument.
  5. Composition represents an “is-a” relationship between two entities.
Which combination of statements is true?

7eb3f58d-598a-4a13-8133-3a7834182d8a.body:
Which of the following scenarios depict true inheritance.
NB: `->` represents the `is a/an`

45bf1789-4995-4f51-96b6-c948fcb1b852.body: Which of these is a valid interpretation of the expression `foo = X()`?

options.A: Create an object foo of class X
options.B: Assign variable foo an instance of X
options.C: Set foo to an instance of X

7f2716ef-7e07-45d6-b608-8cca2011168b.body: The code `class X(object): def __init__(self, J)` can be interpreted as:

options.A: Make a subclass X of class object that defines a constructor method that takes self and J as parameters
options.B: Make a class X of object with a constructor method that has as parameters self and J
options.C: Make a class X that inherits from an object class and has defined a constructor method that accepts as arguments the values of self and J

57b800fe755f6214006d7033.name: QUIZ 4
57b800fe755f6214006d7033.description: This section will test understanding of data structures.

9dfe218d-6ee8-47e2-bec4-f5360b15b7d9.body:
Of the following statements, which ones can be said to be TRUE?
  1. The time complexity of all single statements is constant
  2. According to the Big O Notation, the time complexity of some statements can be said to be logarithmic
  3. Time complexity can only be expressed by using the Big O notation
  4. Time complexity can be expressed as a differential equation
  5. The time complexity of an algorithm can vary over time
  6. Quadratic time complexity can be expressed as a quadratic equation

7f40c0a5-f6ef-45f4-87f0-ffce7b04ceee.body: You are writing a Python e-commerce program that reminds users of the contents of their wish list in the order that they put the items in. Which data structure best simulates the behavior you want to achieve?

fe8d7629-b51f-4756-9621-aa55291ed162.body:
In relation to both primitive and complex data structures, what CANNOT be said to be TRUE?
  1. Primitive data structures are used to represent semantically independent values whilst complex data structures are NOT
  2. Complex data structures are used to represent interdependent values
  3. Complex data structures are complicated to use whilst basic data structures are simple to use
  4. Basic data structures can be used out of the box in a programming language
  5. Complex data structures should only be used with a large data set

2e0b2dff-877f-4919-ad44-f21be5c20735.body: You have a subscription input field on a client’s website and need a method to ensure that any email address and username in the client's database is unique. What should you use to achieve this?

options.A: An ordered list because Grace needs to know when each user subscribed to the website
options.B: A set because each username and email needs to be singular
options.C: A slice because Grace will have to extract the names of each user from their email address
options.D: A dictionary because she needs to link each user's name to their email address

9f815fb3-3aab-4128-a823-c7a7bf9a838c.body: You are designing an algorithm that ranks website pages by relevance according to the number of times they are viewed by users. Which data structure would be the most useful and efficient for you to use?

options.A: A hash table because data would be efficiently searched and retrieved
options.B: A stack because the website pages would need to be popped and pushed systematically from the ranking list
options.C: A graph because Elizabeth needs data relating to how webpages are connected to each other and how many times they were viewed
options.D: A sorted array because all the data relating to web pages needs to be sorted in a ranking order

98fc7260-a271-44c3-af49-00032103d37f.body: What is the efficiency of an algorithm dependent on?

options.A: The time taken by the algorithm and memory consumption
options.B: The data structure used and memory consumption
options.C: The time taken by the algorithm and data structure used

aae6b2ba-aaa9-42f3-98b8-18914db02f2b.body:
You are creating an inventory management system in Python. You want the following features:

  2. The order of the items in the database is not a priority
  3. You need to be able to easily lookup data for each item
Which is the best representation of the optimal data structure you should use to manage the data in this application?

e6d4c29f-e010-4af6-b963-1f07a61a07cd.body:
Look at this code snippet which is supposed to print a series of numbers to the screen. 
a = 1
while a:
    a += 23
    print a
What is wrong with this code snippet and how would you improve it?

options.A: a is being incremented by 23, it needs to be incremented by 1 instead
options.B: a was initialized to 1. It should have been initialized to 0
options.C: Printing a after every loop is inefficient. Print after the loop has ended.
options.D: The loop won’t end. It needs to have a stopping condition

options.A: Software is executable code that serves some computational purpose

options.B: A systems software engineer analyzes user needs and design

options.D: A systems software engineer develops packaged systems and systems software

b1ae4ad2-c85e-48d3-93c2-ea4bc2b3a8d4.body: Which of the choices below include some steps taken in SDLC?

73c02ace-e5d9-4834-bc9b-c82fc6007146.body: Which of the following statements best describes evolutionary/breadboard prototyping?

options.A: Building multiple functional prototypes of the various sub-systems then integrating all the available prototypes to form a complete system
options.B: Building functional prototypes with minimal functionality at the beginning which forms the basis of future prototypes on top of which the system is built
options.C: A prototype is built using little effort with the minimum requirements of the system, and once the requirements are understood, the actual system is developed based off the prototype
